lines.text: They call it the Fetterman massacre, after the officer who swore that with 80 men, he could wipe out the entire Sioux nation. It was no massacre. Them soldiers were stupid, and they rode to their deaths.
[Indian warriors fire barrages of arrows at Fetterman's troops]

[after pursuing a group of Indians on horseback who started to scatter]
They scattered. They scattered!
[Fires his rifle in the air]
Give me a civilized war! An enemy I can find and beat! An enemy who fights by the rules!

[Reno and Benteen discover the remains of Custer's annihilated cavalry at the Little Bighorn]
Oh, how white they look.
There he is. Damn him. Ah, he'll never fight anymore.

[Upon realizing he had ran into Crazy Horse's warriors]
Oh God. This is not the end of the village. This is the middle!

[a doctor tends to the wounded deserters]
Stay away from that wagon, doctor. I have no sympathy with those men. They will receive no aid. Is this clear?

[Grant shows Red Cloud a map of the Black Hills]
This is your land.

[Red Cloud observes the map, then speaks to the interpreter, who translates to Grant]
He says, why these lines?
Boundaries, where the land ends.

[Interpreter translates to Red Cloud, who replies to him]
It is lies.

[Grant, outraged by his response, stands to his feet. Red Cloud also does the same and mutters a word of English]
Lies.
Let me know what the women are wearing.
I'll study them carefully.
Don't you dare.
What happened here, Captain Benteen?
Mistakes were made.

We Cheyenne called him, Hi-Es-Tsie, Long Hair. The Arikara called him, Creeping Panther, who comes in the night. The Crow called him, Son of the Morning Star, who attacks at dawn. I remember him. I saw him die.
Those of you who wish to make their escape follow me!

[Speaking to Red cloud through an interpretor]
You tell him this very directly. Survival is victory, Chief Red Cloud. You can't stop us now. You can only survive among us.

[Speaking the words of Crazy Horse]
One does not sell the land upon which all living creatures walk.

[as he watches Reno attack]
It begins!

[to his men as they charge]
All right, boys, we caught 'em nappin!

[Referring to little Big horn]
Anger was our best weapon that day.

[to Libby]
I didn't marry you for me to sleep in one bed and you in another.

[Indignantly to Benteen]
Captain! Permission to ride to the sound of the firing, SIR!
